abstract: Corsico Journal; mayor of small Italian town of Corsico refuses to provide school lunches to families behind on their school fees; community is divided over issue, which reflects deeper economic malaise in Italy, society where food is sacrosanct; critics worry policy will harm disadvantaged children who most benefit from meal.

headline.print_headline: Cafeteria Crackdown Prompts Uproar in Italy
headline.main: Cafeteria Crackdown Prompts Cries of Bean Counting in Italy

snippet: The mayor, seeing that Corsico had a debt of over a million euros in unpaid lunch fees, decided that children whose parents had not paid would not be allowed to eat cafeteria-prepared meals.
lead_paragraph: The mayor, seeing that Corsico had a debt of over a million euros in unpaid lunch fees, decided that children whose parents had not paid would not be allowed to eat cafeteria-prepared meals.
